alice ketyll upon perverse hereticall opinion caused make personall appearance examined touching sorcery found enquest practised sorcery among one foule fact certaine spirit named robyn artysson lay offered unto nine red cockes stone bridge certaine foure crosse high way item swept street kilkenny beesomes complin courefew sweeping filth toward house william utlaw sonne way conjuring mumbled word unto house william sonne hie wealth kilkenny towne complices said alice agreed unto divelish wretched practise one pernill meth basilia daughter pernil named alice inquisition attainted foresaid imputation bishop punished purse caused utterly abjure sorcerie witchcraft afterwards shee stood convict eftsoones crime herselfe foresaid basilia fled never found said pernill burnt kilkenny houre death shee avouched foresaid william deserved death well selfe affirming yeere day wore divels girdle upon bare bodie whereupon bishop caused said william bee apprehended laid prison eight nine weekes within castle kilkenny bishop decree appointment hee two men give attendance minister unto expresse commandement speake unto day eat drinke length said william helpe lord arnald poer seneschall countie kilkenny delivered forth prison foresaid william gave great summe money unto abovenamed arnold imprison bishop aforesaid lord arnold named caused bishop aforesaid lye prison three moneths among good implement said alice certaine holy wafercake found name divell imprinted upon found also boxe within ointment wherewith used besmear grease certaine piece wood called coultree thus annointed said alice complices could ride gallop upon said coultree whethersoever would world thick thin without either hurt hindrance foresaid thing notorious alice cited againe appeare dublin deane church st patricke finde greater favour made appearance craved day answer sufficient mainprise suretiship thought shee seene counsell sonne others knowne kept hidden farme house village untill winde served england passed never knowne whither went found inquisition recognizance said parnell condemned burnt william utlaw consenting mother sorcerie withcraft bishop caused arrested taken king writ kept prison end supplication great lord set free yet condition cause church mary kilkenny covered lead doe almesdeeds certaine time almesdeeds performed within said terme state wherein stood taken vertue king processe mcccxxvi parliament holden whitsontide kilkenny unto parliament came lord richard burk earle ulster although somewhat weake crazie thither repaired also lord potentate ireland said earle made great noble feast unto lord people afterwards lord earle taking leave noble lord went athisell ended life little feast john baptist enterred lord william burk became heire mcccxxvii arose quarrell fray betweene lord moris fitzthomas lord arnald pover lord moris traine company lord botiller lord william bermingham lord arnald retinew bourkeins said lord morrice fitzthomas slew many chased connaght yeere michaelmas lord arnald came aide bourkeins occasion certaine rude uncivill tearmes lord arnald given calling rymour said morice raised armie againe together botiller said william bermingham puissant hoast burnt land possession said lord arn • ld ofath also said william bermingham fired land man house lord arnald pover mounster kenlys osserie burnt lord arnald forced fly baron donnyl waterford remained moneth untill earle kildare lord justice ireland others king counsel took day betweene day lord arnald kept came dublin passed sea england feast purification arnald sailed said moris botiller lord william bermingham great armie came spoiled harried burnt land said arnald reason puissant force led many mischiefes done king minister counsell feared lest would besiege city therefore city made provision warding watching betweene said lord moris botiler william heard city made provision preparation hand gave intelligence unto king counsell would come kilkenny cleere himselves never thought doe noisance land soveraigne lord king onely revenged enemy unto parliament came earle kildare justice ireland prior kilmaynon wit roger outlaw chancellour ireland nicholas fastoll justice bench others king counsell foresaid moris william demanded king charter peace king counsell warily making answer tooke day unto moneth easter might fellowes counsell treat upon point yeere lent irish leinster gathered together set certain king namely donald sonne arte macmurgh made king determined set banner two mile dublin afterwards passe land ireland whose pride malice god seeing suffered fall hand lord henry traharn brought salmon leap 200 pound life ransome led dublin wait untill king counsell could provide take order doe taking many infortunities lighted upon irish leinster wit lord john wellesley took david othothiel prisoner many irish slaine yeere adam duff sonne walter duff leinster kinred otothiles convicted catholike faith hee denied incarnation jesus christ held could bee three person one god hee affirmed blessed virgin mary mother lord harlot hee denied also resurrection dead avouched sacred scripture fable nothing else imputed falsitie upon sacred apostolicall see every article adam duff pronounced hereticke blasphemer whereupon adam decree church munday outas easter yeere 1328 burnt hoggis greene dublin mcccxxviii tuesday easter week thomas fitzjohn earle kildare justice ireland died succeeded office justice frier roger outlaw prior kilmaynok yeere david otothil strong thiefe enemy king burner church destroier people brought forth castle dublin tolstale citie nicolas fastoll elia ashbourne justice king bench justice gave judgement first drawne horse tailes midst citie unto gallowes afterward hanged upon jebbit done accordingly item yeere lord moris fitzthomas raised great army destroy bourkeins poers yeere also lord william bourk knighted london whitsunday king gave unto seignory also yeere iames botiller england espoused daughter earle hereford created earle ormund called earle tiperary yeere parliament holden northampton many lord noble england assembled peace renewed betweene scotland england ireland marriage ordained earle ulster many noble england goe barwick upon tweed espousal assurance making yeere said espousal contract made barwicke lord robert brus king scotland lord william burk barraies ireland hath lying hard little iland silly upon coast ancient silures whose name seemeth retaine still shadow like small town glancorganshire yet dare avouch silura insula silurum iland cape whereof named hertnesse lieth 14 mile larger counted twaine howbeit reported bee much two mile long one mile broad encircled rockes cliffes round avenue unto one two place fort sconce ruines whereof like helen chappell yet seene beene time past eared plough ridge furrowes doe evidently shew commodity profit yeeldeth doth arise seafowle whereof hath great store tree hath none stinking elder stare haunt multitude uneth dung comming unto meane stand hereupon considering sir thomas delamere knight reporting silly king edward second froward unreasonable wife together unruly baron cambrensis betweene northren coast ireland britaine isle namely whether two country ought right appertaine arose small doubt among ancient time length controversie taken manner much land fostered venemous wormes brought hither triall adjudged common censure doome lye unto britain howbeit inhabitant language manner come nighest unto irish yet therewith savour somewhat quality norvegians lieth length north south much thirty italian mile reacheth bredth widest scarce fifteene mile narrowest eight bede dayes contained three hundred family like anglesey 96 numbreth seventeene parish church flaxe hempe beareth abundantly hath fresh pasture field good manuring plenteous barley wheat oates especially whence people eate oaten bread store cattell every mighty flockes sheepe sheepe cattell also bee smaller body like ireland neighbouring upon england nothing faire headed considering hath wood use fewell kind clammy turfe digging earth light many time upon tree buried ground middest riseth hils standing thick highest whereof sceafull whence man may see cleere faire day scotland england ireland chiefe towne count russin situate southside castle wherein lieth garison commonly writing charge certaine iudges chuse among call deemsters magistrate taketh stone hath given mark delivereth unto plaintiffe vertue thereof citeth adversary witness fall doubtfull case greater importance referred twelve men terme keyes iland hath certain coroner call annos stand stead sheriffes execute office ecclesiasticall judge doth cite person determine cause within eight dayes stand award clapt prison heard say peculiar language also peculiar lawes signes peculiar seigniory ecclesiasticall lawes next canon law come neerest unto civill upon iudge clerk court making processe south north common speech resembleth scottish irish haply worth labour insert little history iland truth due demandeth hand may keepe alive remembrance still act heretofore atchieved bee buried yet succeeded kingdome harald son godwin harald harfager king norway came field fought battell stainfordbridge english obtaining victory put flight chace godred surnamed crovan son harald black iseland came unto godred sonne syrric reigned man honourably received yeere william bastard conquered england godred sonne syrric died succeeded sonne fingal mlxvi godred crovan assembled great fleet came man fought people land overcome put rout second time hee rallied force fleet sailed man joined battell manksmen vanquished driven field third time gathered great multitude together night arrived called ramsa hid three hundred men within wood stood upon hanging hollow brow hill called scacafel sunne risen manksmen put people order battell violent charge encountred godred fight hot three hundred men starting ambush behind backes began foile manksmen put worst yea forced flye saw discomfited place refuge escape sea water comming tide filled channell ramsa river enemy side followed chace hard remained alive tooke pitifull cry besought godred save life moved compassion pittying wofull calamity certain time beene nursed brought among sounded retrait forbad hoast pursue longer goared morrow proposed choice unto owne army whether would rather divide man among therein dwell take substance pillage countrey returne unto owne home chose rather wast spoile whole iland good thereof enrich returne home godred himselfe ilanders remained inhabited south part iland granted remaines manksmen north part covenant condition none time venture presume challenge part land right inheritance whereby came passe even unto day whole isle king domain alone revenue thereof belonging unto crown godred reduced dublin great part leymistir subjection western scottish overawed man built ship cogboat durst drive three nailes reigned 16 yeeres died iland called yle left behind verily three son lagman harald olave lagman eldest taking upon kingdome reigned seven yeeres harald brother great rebelled length taken prisoner lagman member generation cut eye plucked head lagman repenting himselfe pulled brother eye gave kingdome owne accord wearing badge lord crosse took journey jerusalem died mlxxv noble lord island hearing death lagman dispatched embassador murecard obrien king ireland requesting hee would send industrious worthy man blood royall king untill olave godreds sonne came full age king willingly yeelded request sent unto one dopnald sonne tade warning charging govern kingdome right belonged unto another gentlenesse modesty come crowne weighing charge lord gave abused place lorded great tyranny committing many outrage villanies reigned cruelly three yeers prince ilands agreed together one conspiracy rose expelled coast fled ireland never looked face mlxxvii one ingemund sent king norway take upon dominion ilands come isle leodus sent messenger noble ilands commandement meet together ordain king mean himselfe companion nothing else rob spoile make good cheere banquet dishonour abuse married wife defloure young maiden yea give himselfe filthy pleasure fleshly lust tidings hereof came noble ilands assembled make king set fire furious wrath sped hast toward surprising night burnt house wherein hee fire sword made quick dispatch company mxcviii abbey mary cistertium cisteaux founded antioch christian comet blazing star appeared yeere field fought isle man • antwas northren men got victorie battell slaine earle oiher macmoras general side yeere magnus king norway son olave son harald harfager desirous try whether corp olave king martyr remained uncorrupt commanded tombe opened notwithstanding bishop clergy withstood king himselfe came boldly thither force brought caused coffin opened seene handled body uncorrupt nothing perished sodainly great feare fell upon haste departed thence next night following olave king martyr appeared unto dreame saying thus chuse thou one two thing either lose thy life kingdome within thirty day depart norway never see againe king awakened called unto prince elder declared unto dreame vision sore affraid gave counsell depart speed norway without delay caused fleet rigged put readinesse hundred threescore saile cutteth isle orkney forthwith subdued making way dint sword thorowout iles bringing subjection went forward still far man arrived landed came unto st patrickes isle see place wherein field beene fought little betweene manksmen yet many body slaine lay unburied saw goodly beautifull iland pleased eye chose seat himselfe therein built fortress unto day carry name galway held great awe compelled cut downe wood timber bring unto shore therewith might build fort bulwarkes anglesey called mona iland wale hee sailed found two earles name hughes one slew put flight subdued iland welshman presented many gift bad farwell returned unto man unto murcard king ireland sent shooes commanded carry shoulder middest house christmas day might thereby understand subject unto king magnus irishman soone heard took grievously disdained exceeding much king following wiser course rather saith onely carry shooes also eat king magnus destroy one province ireland hee fulfilled therefore commandement honourably entreated messenger many present also hee sent unto king magnus entred league messenger returned unto lord related unto many thing touching situation ireland pleasantnesse thereof abundance corne wholsomnesse aire magnus heard straightwaies thought nothing else conquer ireland bring wholly dominion commanded therefore men prepare navie himselfe person setting forward sixteene ship desirous take view countrey unwarily departed aside shipping suddenly compassed irish lost life together manner buried hard patrick church doun hee reigned sixe yeeres whose death prince ilands sent olave son godred surnamed crovan lived court henry king england son king william mcii olave sonne godred crovan aforesaid beganne reigne reigned forty yeeres peaceable prince king ireland scotland confederate hee tooke wife affrica daughter ferguse gallway begat gadred concubine regnald lagman harald beside many daughter whereof one wedded summerled prince herergaidel cause ruine whole king ilands begat foure sonnes dulgall raignald engus olave mcxxxiii hapned great eclipse sun upon fourth none august day turned night mcxxxiv olave gave unto yuo abbat furnes plot land man build abbay place called russin enriched revenue endowed priviledges estate church ilands mcxlii godred olaves son saileth sea king norway whose name hinge homage unto staied honourably entertained yeere three sonnes harald olaves brother brought dublin raising great number men together fled king came man demanding king one moity whole kingdome ilands bee given unto king heard demand willing pacifie answered hee would take counsell matter appointed time place counsell bee held meane leud wicked villaines complotted among king death day appointed part met called ramsa sat order rowes king counsell one side together company reginald dispatch midst stood talking apart one peeres land king called come unto turned toward king though hee would salute therewith lifting glittering axe great height one blow cut king head forthwith soone committed bloody murder divided land among day gathered navie together failed galway desirous bring also subjection galway sticking close round together gave faire onset joined battell turning backes fled great disorder man galwaymen dwelt therein slew others expelled mcxliii godred olaves son returning norway created king man avenge father death caused two haralds son eies pulled slew third mcxliv godred begun reigne reigned thirty yeeres third yeere reigne people dublin sent created king dublin murecard king ireland raised war encamping himselfe citie called coridelis sent halfe brother mother side osibeley three thousand men armes dublin godred dublinians slaine rest put flight exploit atchieved godred returned man began use tyranny turned nobleman inheritance whereof one called thorsin oters son mightier rest came sumerled made dubgall sumerleds son king ilands subduing unto many ilands godred intelligence thing one paul prepared navie setteth forward meet sumerled comming fleet 80 saile yeere 1156 battell fought sea twelfe day night many man slaine side next day grew pacification divided among kingdome ilands became two severall kingdomes day unto present time cause overthrow kingdome isle since time sumerleds son seized upon mclviii sumerled came man fleet 53 saile put godred flight wasted iland godred crossed norway seek aid sumerled mclxiv sumerled gathered together fleet 1060 ship arrived rhinfrin coveting subdue scotland judgement god hee vanquished together sonne infinite number people slain yeere field fought ramsae betweene reginald brother godred man deceitfull practice certaine earle man put flight reginald began reigne fourth day came godred upon norway great multitude armed men tooke brother reginald bereft eye genitall member yeere died malcolm king scotland brother william succeeded kingdome mclxvi two comet blazing star appeared sunrising moneth august one south north mclxxi richard earle penbrock sailed ireland subdued develin great part ireland mclxxvi john curey conquered ulster vivian legate apostolicke sea came man caused king godred bee lawfully espoused unto wife phingola daughter maclotlen son murkartac king ireland wit mother olave three yeers old sylvan abbat married unto day godred gave piece land miriscoge built monastery length ground together monkes granted abbey russin reginald sonne eacmarcat one royall blood comming man great band men king absence first conflict put flight certain warder kept shore killed 30 men afterwards manksmen gathering force together day slew almost company mclxxxiii ofogolt sheriffe man mclxxxv fell eclipse sun saint philip jacob day mclxxxvii fourth ides november died godred king ilands next summer body translated isle hy left behind three sonnes reginald olave tvar life ordained sonne olave heire hee onely borne lawfull wedlock people man seeing olave scarce ten yeeres old sent reginald iles set king mclxxxviii reginald godreds son began raigne ilands murchard man great power throughout kingdome iles slaine mcxcii battell fought betweene reginald engus sonnes sumerled engus victory yeere abbey russin translated dufglas foure yeeres monk returned russin mcciii michael bishop isle died fontans succeeded nicolas mcciv hugh lacy came army ulster gave john curcy battell tooke prisoner conquered ulster afterward hee set john liberty came king reginald honourably entertained brother law john curcy taken wife affrica godreds daughter founded abbey mary de iugo domini buried mccv john curcy reginald king iles entred ulster one hundred ship called stranford slackly besieged fortresse rath walter lacy comming upon army put flight curcy never recovered land mccx engus sumerleds son three sonnes slaine john king england time brought navie 500 saile ireland subdued sending certaine earle named fulk unto man one fortnight day wholly manner wasted taking hostage returned thence country king reginald noble man mccxvii nicolas bishop ilands departed life buried ulster within house benchor succeeded reginald thinke good write somewhat againe olave reginald brother reginald gave unto brother olave ile called lodhus said larger rest ilands slenderly inhabited stand much upon mountaines stony besides almost unfit tillage inhabitant thereof live part hunting fishing olave therfore went possesse himselfe iland dwelt leading poore life saw would suffice maintaine himselfe army came boldly unto brother reginald made abode ilands spake unto maner brother saith hee soveraigne lord king thou knowest kingdome ilands belonged unto inheritance since lord hath elected thee sway scepter thereof envie thee take grievously thou art exalted royall dignity thus much heartily beseech thee thou wouldest provide portion land iles wherein may live honestly according mine estate iland lodhus thou gavest unto sufficient sustaine reginald brother given hearing said would take counsell upon point morrow olave sent came place parley matter reginald commandeth hee apprehended brought unto william king scotland might kept prison olave lay prisoner iron chaines almost seven yeeres seventh yeere died william king scotland succeeded sonne alexander death gave commandement prisoner set free olave therefore enlarged liberty came man soone accompanied small traine nobleman went james thus returned reginald brother caused marry noble man daughter kentyre even owne wife whole sister named lavon gave lodhus possession enjoy day reginald bishop ilands called synod canonically divorced olave sonne godred lavon wife cousin german former wife olave wedded scristine daughter ferkar earle rosse cause reginalds wife queene ilands wroth directed letter name reginald king ile sky unto godred sonne kill olave godred devising meanes worke feat entring lodhus olave fled little cogboat unto father law earle rosse aforesaid godred wasteth spoileth lodhus time pol son boke sheriffe sky man great authority ilands would give consent unto godred fled together olave lived earle ross house entring league olave came one ship sky length sent forth spy discoverer learned godred lay certain iland called st columbs ile men misdoubting nothing gathering therefore friend acquaintance voluntary ready joine midnight five shippes drew next seashore distant island aforesaid two furlong beset isle round godred rising dawning day seeing environed every side enemy astonied putting warlike armes assaied right manfully make resistance vaine nine clocke day olave pol foresaid sheriffe set foot iland whole army slain found without enclosure church tooke godred put eye gelded howbeit deed olave yeeld consent neither could withstand bokes sonne sheriffe aforesaid done yeere 1223 summer next following olave taken hostage lord potentate isle came fleet 32 saile toward man arrived rognolfwaht time reginald olave divided kingdome ilands man given reginald beside owne portion together title cannot picke unlesse thinke called groweth corne graine solinus writethscottish westerne iles inhabitant ilands acquainted corne live onely upon fish milke eb eid british soundeth much without corne inhabitant saith solinus skill knowledge corne live fish milke onely one king many soever severed one another narrow enterflow sea betweene king hath nothing hee may say owne thing common held hee equity certaine lawes lest hee covetousnesse swarve aside truth poore estate learneth justice hath house furniture provision owne maintenance common coffer woman allowed propriety turnes hee taketh use whomsoever hee fancieth whereby hee neither wish hope child island common people affirmeth bee 44 whereas truth many pliny wrote 30 ptolomee reckoneth five first ricina pliny calleth ricnea antoninus riduna termed racline think read antonine riclina cl easily maketh joining c backe unto small iland butting full upon ireland knowne unto ancient writer lieth narrow sea betweene ireland lieth iona bede tearmeth hy hu given picts unto scottish monkes propagating preaching gospell among stood monasterie famous reason scottish king tombes frequent conversing holy men therein among columba apostle picts principall whose cell iland also called columbkill like man also himselfe compound name termed columbkill bede witnesseth length bishop seat ordained sodore little towne whence iles also called sodorensis reckoned diocesse maleo ptolomee writeth called mula whereof plinie seemeth make mention hee saith mella reported bee 25 mile larger rest read ancient edition plinie printed venice whereas vulgar copy steed reliquarum mella read reliquarum nulla none rest c eastern hebuda called skie hence lieth great length shore coast scotland westerne hebuda bending westward called lewis lord whereof maccloyd ancient history man named lodhus full steep craggie little hill stony slenderly inhabited howbeit largest eust disjoined narrow wash rest save onely hyrtha small account either stony else inaccessible reason craggy cliffes scarce clad greensord yet scot purchased ready mony norwegian said beene buttress pillar kingdome although reape small commodity thereby considering inhabitant ancient true scot irish men stout stomackes desperate boldnesse meanes subject severity lawes awed justice touching manner apparell language differ nothing wild irishry spoken wee may easily know thereby one selfe nation originally beare sway doe rule ilands family macconel macalen others terme maclen maccloyd lewis maccloyd harich mightiest house macconels glory pedegree derived donald reigne iames third stiled himselfe king ilands kinde cruelty savage barbarous manner plagued scotland notwithstanding sonne outlawed paied deerely forced submit whole estate absolutely countrey scotland promontory use call cathnesse inhabitant whereof seeme named amisse ptolomee carini catini solinus time man dwelled overgrowne vinceis iunceis herbis binding rushy weed inhabited voice calling unto work rise shore goe knowing causeth goe see boat prepared none owne men entred fall oares feele weight said boat laden men see body one push come british iland trice whereas otherwise ship could hardly get thither day night sailing come iland see creature heare voice receive shipboard count kinred father mother yea call one one according dignity art name ship discharged load return home againe one yerke oares hence many men thinke ilands blessed ghost stampe also may poeticall geographer seeme muretus maketh mention variety reading hath written c iulius caesar went thither great galley hundred men aboard willing seated himselfe wondrously delighted incredible pleasantnesse place full struggling could contrary throwne invisible inhabitant thulefive day night sailing isle orkney solinus placeth thule iland often celebrated poet whensoever would signifie thing remote farre furthest part whole world hereupon saith virgil tibi serviat ultima thule let thule remote thee serve seneca terrarum ultima thule thule farthest land juvenal de conducendo loquitur jam rhetore thule thule speakes oratours hire claudian thulen procul axe remotam thule far remote pole another place ratibus que impervia thule thule ship passe statius ignotam vincere thulen conquer thule unknowne ammianus marcellinus way adage proverbiall speech useth word etiamsi apud thulen moraretur although made abode even thule passe testimony give leave yet note thus much moreover said statius used thule britainethule britaine verse caerulus haud alitèr cùm dimicat incola thule agmina falcifero circumvenit acta covino even blew inhabitant thule fight environ battels marching sithed chariot might also place poem entituled sylvae seemeth —restuo circumsona gurgite thule thule doth resound amaine sea ebbes flowes againe suidas writeth tooke name thule king aegypt isidore sunne reynerus reneccius saxon word tell limit bound north west yet synesius doubteth whether thule giraldus cambrensis writeth extant seene better sort learned men sundry judgement concerning affirmed island island subject extreme sharpe cold continuall winter beene called time past thule saxo grammaticus crantzius milius iovius peucerus contrary opinion neither ignorant vast huge country scandia described procopius name thule lib 2 belli gothici true learned peucer hath recorded book entituled de dimensione terrae measuring earth sailers call shetland thilensel neither dare empeach credit surely wee found thule matter end questionlesse shetland isle scottish dominionshetland call hethland environed islet nipped frost chilly cold lying open every side unto bitter storm inhabitant whereof like island use steed breadcorne dried fish braied beaten call stockfish although north pole elevated continuall day sixe moneths together pithaeas marsils hath fained thule hee justly taxed strabo hapneth island selfe manner continuall winter intolerable settled cold yet man thinke shetland thule first situation thereof ptolomee may induce set 63 degree aequinoctiall thule ptolomee lieth norway scotland saxo grammaticus placeth thule two day sailing distant point caledonia cathnes according distance solinus placeth thule also tacitus saith roman kenned thule afar sailed round britain orcades lastly faceth shore bergae norway place thule lieth according pomponius mela author reading corruptly belgarum littori stead bergarum bergae citie norway lieth shetland pliny nameth tract bergosbergos doubt little country wherein bergae flourishethnerigon like man deny norway nerigon specified pliny enough thule snow winter weather one saith hath hidden ancient writer u assure neither able say northren ilands meant spake much thule touching length day unknowne iland festus avienus hee treated britaine translated dionysius verse long dehinc celeri si quis rate marmora currat inveniet vasto surgentem gurgite thulen hic cùm plaustra poli tangit phaebeius ignis nocte sub inlustri rota solis fomite flagrat continuo clarumque diem nox aemula ducit hence one pinnace swift along sea doth saile thule ocean vast finde shall faile northren pole sun fire doth sejourne night lightsome wheeles continually doe burne night say resembling day faire light make soone returne pomponius mela likewise hath noted word opposite unto coast bergae lieth thule iland much renowned greek
